article.para: Ubuntu comes with 16 games by default, including Aisleriot Solitaire, Gnometris, and Mines.

sect1.title: Frozen-Bubble
sect1.para: In Frozen-Bubble you attempt to shoot bubbles into groups of the same color to cause them to pop.

step.para: Install the frozen-bubble package from the Universe repository (see Add Applications).

To start Frozen-Bubble, choose
Applications Games Frozen-Bubble .

sect1.title: PlanetPenguin Racer
sect1.para: Race Tux, the Linux mascot, down a snow- and ice-covered mountain as quickly as possible, avoiding the trees and rocks that will slow you down.

note.para: Ensure you have hardware accelerated 3D drivers installed for your video card. For more information see .

step.para: Install the planetpenguin-racer package from the Universe repository (see Add Applications).

To start PlanetPenguin Racer, choose
Applications Games PlanetPenguin-Racer .

sect1.title: Scorched3D
sect1.para:
Scorched3D is a 3D remake of Scorched Earth, an artillery duel game.
Ensure you have hardware accelerated 3D drivers installed for your video card. For more information see .

step.para: Install the scorched3d package from the Universe repository (see Add Applications).

To start Scorched3D, choose
Applications Games scorched 3d .

sect1.title: Windows Games
sect1.para: Many games which are available for Windows can be run on Linux through emulators. Examples of these emulators are Wine and Cedega.

step.para: For information about Wine, see the Ubuntu wiki.
For information about Cedega, see the Ubuntu wiki
